page.title: 04BRAILES,THE FARMING PATTERN
page.content: The area is divided into medium sized arable and livestock farms.Wheat and barley are the main crops with lesser amounts of oilseed rape, oats, beans and potatoes. Substantial numbers of animals are maintained _ cattle for milk and beef, sheep for meat and wool,and pigs. Barley straw is used to feed livestock. Much of the wheat straw is used for litter though a small quantity is being chemically treated to be used as fodder. The surplus is disposed of by burning or ploughing in. Grassland, some permanent, mostly temporary, is used for grazing and providing winter fodder for livestock in the form of silage and hay.
